description: *A mudmaw receives a +20 bonus on Hide checks conid can release a cloud of spores. These when in water. spores come in several different varieties, as described below. As it enters each new stage of life (increasing its Hit Dice by 1), a myconid gains a new variety of spore but does not lose access to the previous varieties. Each type of spore can be used a number of times per day equal to the myconid’s Hit Dice. A 3-HD myconid, for example, has the first three spores (distress, repro- duction, and rapport), and it can use each variety three times per day. Spores can be released either in a 120-foot spread or as a 40-foot ray against a single target, as noted in the individual spore descriptions.
name: Skills

description: These spores alert all other myconids within the area that danger is near. They are released in a 120-foot spread.
name: Distress

description: These spores eventu- ally germinate into new infant my- conids. They are released as a 120-foot spread and have no detrimental effects on nonmyconids.
name: Reproduction

description: These spores are released as a 40-foot ray. The though it were a Tiny plant. target must make a Fortitude saving throw (DC varies; see individual descriptions) or become passive for 1 minute. JUNIOR WORKERS Being passive is similar to being dazed, except that the target These youngsters are four to eight years old. They assist can take partial actions that don’t involve attacking. description: A nimblewright is immune to mind- affecting effects, poison, sleep, paralysis, stunning, disease, death effects, necromantic effects, and any effect that requires a Fortitude save unless it also works on objects. The crea- ture is not subject to critical hits, subdual damage, ability damage, ability drain, energy drain, or death from massive damage. It cannot heal itself but can be healed through repair. It cannot be raised or resurrected. A nimblewright has darkvision (60-foot range).
